title: Thai Yellow Pumpkin And Seafood Curry
summary: The recipe Thai Yellow Pumpkin And Seafood Curry could satisfy your Indian craving in approximately 45 minutes. This main course has 620 calories, 58g of protein, and 32g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4. For $7.79 per serving, this recipe covers 48% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have pak choi, juice of lime, salmon fillet, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the pumpkin you could follow this main course with the Pumpkin Desserts: Pumpkin Cream Puffs as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian diet. This recipe is liked by 858 foodies and cooks. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 98%. This score is super. Try Thai Yellow Pumpkin and Seafood Curry, Thai Yellow Curry With Seafood Recipe, and Thai Yellow Curry Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gruener Veltliner, Riesling, and Sparkling ros√© are my top picks for Indian. The best wine for Indian food will depending on the dish, of course, but these picks can be served chilled and have some sweetness to complement the spiciness and complex flavors of a wide variety of traditional dishes. The Pratsch Organic Gruner Veltliner with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pratsch Organic Gruner Veltliner
productMatches.description: 100% Certified Organic Gruner Veltliner. This wine is herbal, fresh and spicy with notes of white pepper, apple and citrus on the palate.
